channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Mark Franklin presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 16 September 1993 and featuring Radiohead, Mot?rhead, Jade, Chaka Demus & Pliers, Belinda Carlisle and Culture Beat.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Jimi Hendrix - Electric Church
channel.desc: A documentary that highlights America's last great rock festival and Jimi Hendrix's legendary performance as its headline act on 4 July 1970. Deals with adult themes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC
channel.desc: Compilation of BBC performances featuring guitarists such as Carlos Santana, Mark Knopfler, The Edge, Peter Green, John Martyn, Pentangle and Paco Pena.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Guitar Heroes at the BBC 2
channel.desc: Compilation of BBC performances featuring guitarists such as Jimi Hendrix, Pete Townshend, Peter Green, Johnny Winter, Manitas De Plata, Ry Cooder, Angus Young and Paul Kossoff.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Even More Guitar Heroes at the BBC
channel.desc: Compilation of classic archive performances from the guitar gods of the late 60s and 70s, including Status Quo, The Who, Dire Straits, Lynyrd Skynyrd, George Benson and Link Wray.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Jo Whiley presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 12 June 1998 and featuring Lutricia McNeal, Shania Twain, Del Amitri, Mariah Carey, England United and B*witched.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Jayne Middlemiss presents the pop chart programme, first broadcast on 19 June 1998 and featuring Five, Pulp, Ian Brown, Dario G, Fat Les and Baddiel, Skinner & The Lightning Seeds.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: TOTP
channel.desc: Peter Powell and Stevie Wright present the pop chart programme, featuring Eurythmics, Michael McDonald, Orchestral Manoeuvres in the Dark, Cameo, The Communards and Five Star.

channel.title: Agatha Christie
channel.desc: Profile celebrating the centenary of the famous author Agatha Christie's birth, looking at her life, her character and the key moments in her childhood that influenced her writing.

channel.title: Miss Marple
channel.desc: When a woman is poisoned during a village fete, the police think the intended victim was a film star - but another murder complicates matters.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Parkinson Meets David Niven
channel.desc: Michael Parkinson in conversation with actor David Niven.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Good Life
channel.desc: Is Margo having an affair? When she is less than honest about her activities, the Goods can't help thinking the worst.

channel.title: Yes Minister
channel.desc: Sitcom about a British government minister. Jim Hacker finds himself in possession of embarrassing information about the sale of arms to terrorists.

channel.title: Around the World in 80 Gardens
channel.desc: this time in India. Monty visits the tomb gardens of the Mughal emperors and the pleasure gardens of the Maharajahs.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Magic of Mozart at the Proms
channel.desc: The Marriage of Figaro, Don Giovanni and more from the Royal Albert Hall in a concert of smash hits celebrating one of the greatest composers of all time.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Life of a Mountain
channel.desc: Terry Abraham films a year in the life of Helvellyn in the Lake District, featuring an exhilarating RAF fighter plane flight through its stunning and much-loved landscape.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Britain's Lost Waterlands:...
channel.desc: Escape to Swallows and Amazons Country. Exploring the landscapes that inspired Arthur Ransome to write Swallows and Amazons.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Socrates
channel.desc: Historian Bettany Hughes is in Greece, on the trail of the hugely influential maverick thinker Socrates, who was executed for his beliefs.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Story of Welsh Art
channel.desc: From the 18th century, the dramatic landscape of Wales captivated artists like Richard Wilson and JMW Turner, who painted it in ways that changed the course of art history.

channel.title: Britain's Lost Masterpieces
channel.desc: Bendor and Emma discover a mysterious portrait of a 16th-century physician.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Call My Bluff

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Face the Music
channel.desc: Joseph Cooper invites viewers to match their musical wits against Valerie Pitts, David Attenborough and Tony Lewis. Featuring guest musician Steuart Bedford.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Anthony Wall Remembers... Arena
channel.desc: Anthony Wall looks back on his time on Arena, from producer to series editor, and celebrates the films and people that made it groundbreaking, unmissable, unforgettable TV.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: My Way - Arena
channel.desc: An investigation of the appeal and power of the popular song My Way, which was written by Paul Anka and recorded by many artists, including Frank Sinatra.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Dreams of William Golding - Arena
channel.desc: An insight into the private obsessions and insecurities of the author of Lord of the Flies. With contributions from his daughter and son and bestselling author Stephen King.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Banana - Arena
channel.desc: Programme exploring the cultural significance of the banana. Featuring contributions from John Cale, Auberon Waugh, John Walters and Brendan Batson.

channel.title: The Good Life

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Yes Minister
channel.desc: Jim Hacker supports the sale of an art gallery, which will help fund his ailing local football club. Sir Humphrey is horrified.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Africa's Lion Kings
channel.desc: A pride of lions has rewritten the rules - they have learnt to take down elephants.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Great Railway Journeys
channel.desc: Michael Palin travels through Northern Ireland and Ireland and finds out more about his Irish ancestors, experiences the 'peace train' from Belfast to Dublin and visits Cork.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Michael Palin
channel.desc: Travelogue. Michael Palin takes his golf clubs to St Andrews on a train journey up the 'drier side of Britain', celebrating a bygone age of rail travel.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Michael Palin - Comic Roots
channel.desc: Michael Palin looks back in languor at his rise to stardom with the help of his mum, his old geography teacher, Spike Milligan, Terry Jones, the boy next door and DP Gumby.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Attica
channel.desc: Prison Uprising - Storyville. Documentary about the violent prison riot that gripped America in 1971. Contains very strong language and graphic violent scenes.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Dan Cruickshank and the Family...
channel.desc: That Built Gothic Britain. How the great icons of British Gothic architecture were all created by one family.

channel.title: Tornado
channel.desc: A documentary, first broadcast in 2017, in which the A1 class steam engine Tornado, financed by enthusiasts and completed in 2008, tries to achieve 100mph on the main line.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Return of Flying Scotsman
channel.desc: Film following the Flying Scotsman, the world's most famous steam engine, as it returns to the tracks following a ten-year restoration which cost more than ?4 million.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Flying Scotsman from the Footplate
channel.desc: The view from the driving seat as Flying Scotsman travels the Severn Valley Railway. Cab cameras and microphones capture all the action.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Ian Hislop Goes off the Rails
channel.desc: Ian Hislop takes a look at the notorious Beeching Report of 1963, which led to the closure of a third of the nation's railway lines and forced thousands of people onto the road.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: Waris Hussein Remembers... The Clothes in the Wardrobe
channel.desc: Director Waris Hussein looks back on the 1993 TV drama The Clothes in the Wardrobe.

channel.name: BBC4 UK
channel.title: The Clothes in the Wardrobe - Screen Two
channel.desc: Nineteen-year-old Margaret is about to marry a dull middle-aged man. Can anyone help her? Contains some scenes of a sexual nature.

channel.title: Crime and Punishment
channel.desc: Documentary that lifts the veil on the taboo that is corporal punishment. Deals with adult themes.

channel.desc: Britain's Lost Railway Journeys. 1/6. A journey back to a lost era of rail travel, when trains had names, character and style.

channel.title: Carrie
channel.desc: A repressed and bullied teenager discovers that she has special powers. Horror. Contains some strong language, some violence and some upsetting scenes.
